did.unittitle: "Analysis of the Agreement Between K.R. Wilson and Local #564 of the International Union, UAW"
did.abstract: "Analysis of the Agreement Between K.R. Wilson and Local #564 of the International Union, UAW," by Nelson M. Ripley.

defitem.label: Contact Information:
defitem.item: Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives Martin P. Catherwood Library 227 Ives Hall Cornell University Ithaca, NY 14853 (607) 255-3183> kheel_center@cornell.edu http://www.ilr.cornell.edu/library/kheel-center

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of "Analysis of the Agreement Between K.R. Wilson and Local #564 of the International Union, UAW," a term paper by Nelson M. Ripley for Professor Jean McKelvey for a course on Contract Making and Administration, Fall 1948.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to the collections in the Kheel Center is restricted. Please contact a reference archivist for access to these materials.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: This collection must be used in keeping with the Kheel Center Information Sheet and Procedures for Document Use.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: "Analysis of the Agreement Between K.R. Wilson and Local #564 of the International Union, UAW" #6222m. Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives, Cornell University Library.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Nelson M. Ripley - After working for the FBI in Washington DC, he joined the US Army and served in the Ordinance Corp during World War II. He finished his service as a Captain. He attended Alfred University, transferred to Cornell University, and graduated in 1949. Later he received his MBA from Fairleigh Dickinson University. His career was spent in business management. He held several positions in that field finally retiring as owner and President of Townley Leasing in Ithaca, NY.

controlaccess.corpname: International Union, United Automobile, Aircraft, and Agricultural Implement Workers of America. Local 564
